issue.title: [Doc] Add copy button extension to code-blocks
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14963](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14963). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
We could add Sphinx extensions to the existing Development part of the documentation so that users will be able to copy-paste code from the code-blocks. Need to make sure that only the code is copied and not $ with it for example.

See the link for ideas:
<https://github.com/pydata/pydata-sphinx-theme/issues/41>

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14963?focusedCommentId=17452351) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
Adding my comment here as well: 

Apparently, sphinx actually already supports having a `$` not copy-pastable out of the box (see eg https://pydata-sphinx-theme.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing.html#set-up-a-basic-development-environment), I _think_ it's a matter of specifying the correct highlighting language for the code blocks (`console` was used in the case of the linked example)

Apart from that, a copy button from `sphinx-copybutton` extension can still be useful in addition, though.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14963?focusedCommentId=17452363) by Alenka Frim (alenka):*
Thanks Joris for the update!
